text: For the \add music\add* director, with stringed instruments. A psalm. A song.\f + \fr Ps 67 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
May God be gracious to us and bless us.
May he cause his face to shine toward us, \qs Selah\qs*
that your way may be known on the earth,
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
let all of the peoples praise you.
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
because you judge \add the\add* peoples with equity
and guide the nations on the earth. \qs Selah\qs*
Let \add the\add* peoples praise you, O God;
let all \add the\add* peoples praise you.
\add The\add* earth has yielded its produce.
God, our God, will bless us.
and all \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* earth will fear him.
